conclusion: Consider the geometry and refraction of light through the semi-cylindrical body.
The semi-cylindrical body has a radius R and length L; light enters vertically through the rectangular surface and exits through the curved surface.
The refractive index of the semi-cylindrical body is n = 2.
Light refracts according to Snell's Law: n1 sin θ1 = n2 sin θ2, where n1 = 2 and n2 = 1.
The critical angle θc for total internal reflection is given by sin θc = 1/2, θc = 30°.
Light will exit the semi-cylinder if the angle of incidence at the curved surface is less than 30°.
The light exits through a portion of the curved surface where the angle of incidence is less than 30°.
The area of the segment is a fraction of the total curved surface area of the semi-cylinder.
The total curved surface area of the semi-cylinder is πRL.
The fraction of the area corresponding to the angle 30° is 1/6.
The area S is S = (1/6) × πRL = πRL/6.
The area S of the part of the cylindrical surface through which light exits is S = πRL/6.
